studyGroups.label: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

emailTemplates.name: 01. Registration Follow-up
emailTemplates.subject: Registration Follow-up
emailTemplates.message:
Hi {{participant_first_name}},

I'm following up on a form you filled out for studies at our research site.  We have one that you may be a candidate for.

Is there a good time to call you for a phone screening?  It should take about 10 minutes. 

Thank you,
Study Team

emailTemplates.name: 02. Delivery Date Approaching
emailTemplates.subject: Schedule your 1 month Study Visit
emailTemplates.message:
Hello {{participant_first_name}},

The with the delivery of your new baby is fast approaching, we would love to schedule your 1-month study visit.

Please fill out this survey before the next visit: {{participant_global_id}}

Please give us a call at 734-531-9794 to schedule or if you have any questions about your enrollment.

Thank you,
Study Team

emailTemplates.name: 03. Appointment Directions and Information
emailTemplates.subject: Directions for your Appointment
emailTemplates.message:
Hello {{participant_first_name}},

Thank you for participating in the {{study_name}} study.  We are looking forward to your {{event_name}} on {{event_date}} and want to make sure you know how to find us when you arrive.

We are located in Kerrytown at the corner of Catherine and Fourth st across from No Thai.  There is a door with the Ripple logo on Fourth Street, please ring the bell and a member of our team will be happy to greet you!

If you have any questions please call 734-531-9794 or email us at studyteam@ripplescience.com

Thanks!
Study Team

surveys.name: 4. Screening Form
5. UCSD Consent
surveys.surveyJSON:
{ "pages": [ { "name": "page1", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question2", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nAPPROVAL DATE: XX/XX/XX

\n\n

\nEXPIRATION DATE: XX/XX/XX

\n\n

\nCONSENT VERSION 1

\n\n\n\n

University of California, San Diego

\n\n

Consent to Act as a Research Subject and Parent Consent for a Child to Act as a Research Subject

\n\n

\nThe HEALthy Brain and Child Development (HBCD) Study

\n\n\n\n

\nIntroduction

\n\n

Dr. Gretchen Bandoli and Dr. Sheila Gahagan are conducting this research at UC San Diego, and asking for your consent for you and your child to participate in a multi-site study being conducted at 25 locations across the United States. This section provides a summary of important information. The rest of the form provides additional details.

\n\n

The purpose of this nation-wide research project is to learn how children grow and change (develop) early in life. We will study children’s thinking, behavior, social interactions, emotions, and brains from birth through 10 years old. The research will look at many factors that might be helpful or harmful to a child’s development. These include exposure to tobacco, alcohol, and other drugs before birth, family members’ mental health and stress, the family’s social and economic environment, the child’s exposure to toxins, and how the parent or caregiver interacts with their child. The overall goal of this study is to better understand how children grow up in different environments. While there is no direct benefit to you from participating, the results of this study may help scientists design new methods for improving the lives of children and their families.

\n\n

If you agree for you and your child to participate, we will ask you to take part in completing interviews, questionnaires and other tests about yourself and your child. We will ask you and your child to wear small devices for a few days to measure stress and or movement. We will ask you and your child to provide some biological samples. Because this study is looking at how a child’s brain develops in the first years of life, we will ask that you allow your child to have brain scans and other measures of how your child’s brain is developing.

\n\n

The most serious potential risks of the study are the social and legal risks that could result the loss of your or your child’s confidentiality if we mistakenly share your information with someone outside the study. We believe the chance that your or your child’s information could disclosed is very small, but we cannot make guarantees. We have many levels of protection in place to prevent this from happening.

" }, { "type": "text", "name": "pscid", "visible": false, "width": "550px", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "title": "PSCID", "surveyVariable": "ParticipantVariable:globalId" } ] }, { "name": "page2", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question3", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "
    \n
  • Research is voluntary - whether or not you agree for you and your child to join is your decision. You can discuss your decision with others (such as family, friends, or your or your child’s doctor).
    • \n\n
  • You can say yes but change your mind later.
    • \n\n
  • If you say no, we will not hold your decision against you or your child, and your decision will not affect your or your child’s health care or any other benefits you or your child may be entitled to.
    • \n\n
  • Please ask questions or mention concerns before, during or after the research.
    • \n
\n\n\n

Additional, detailed information about this research is provided below.

\n\n\n\n

\nWhy you and your child have been asked to participate, how you and your child were selected, and what is the approximate number of participants in the study?

\n\n

You and your child have been asked to participate in this study because you are pregnant or have just delivered a child in San Diego. There will be approximately 300 birth parents and their children participating at the San Diego site. There will be approximately 7,500 birth parent-child pairs participating at all 25 sites across the United States.

\n\n\n\n

\nWhat will happen to you or your child in this study?

\n\n

You will be asked to do some activities in person at the San Diego study location and some activities in your home (by computer, tablet or phone). In the first 5 years of the research you will be asked to do the following:

\n\n
    \n
  • Provide contact information including your phone number, address, email, and contact information of relatives and friends. We will use this information to help contact you for study visits. If we contact a relative or friend, we will only tell them this is about a study of child development. No other information about the study or about you or your child will be given.
    • \n\n
  • Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires on a computer, tablet or phone. These will include questions about your medical and pregnancy history, your current pregnancy, mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background.
    • \n\n
  • Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about your child’s development on a computer, tablet, or phone including questions about the child’s growth, physical activity, sleep, mood, behavior, relationships with friends, family and other activities.
    • \n\n
  • Wear a small device for 3 days during pregnancy to measure your level of stress.
    • \n
" } ] }, { "name": "page3", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question33", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

You will be asked to allow your child to do the following:

\n\n
    \n
  • Have a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain on 4 occasions in the first 4 years of life.
    • \n\n
  • Have an electroencephalogram (EEG) of your child’s brain activity on 3 occasions in the first 4 years of life.
    • \n\n
  • Wear 2 small devices in a set of stockings, and 1 device on the chest for 3 continuous days on 2 occasions in the first year of life. This will measure their movement, sleep cycles and heart rate.
    • \n\n
  • Have measurements taken of your child’s weight, length and head size on 4 occasions in the first 4 years of life.
    • \n\n
  • Have some direct tests to measure your child’s learning, memory and behavior on 3 occasions in the first 4 years of life.
    • \n
\n\n

The brain MRI visits will be scheduled at one of the MRI Centers at UC San Diego. We will give you directions and free parking. Because MRI involves being placed in a strong magnetic field, it is not safe for your child to be in or near an MRI scanner if they have metal on their body, such as pierced earrings. You will be asked to remove anything metallic from your child before the scan.

\n\n

The EEGs will be done at the study location near Rady Children’s hospital. Your child will wear a special head “net” or cap for a brief period of time while doing the study tasks.

\n\n\n\n

You will be asked to provide some biological samples from yourself that include the following:

\n\n
    \n
  • A urine sample of about 6-7 tablespoons collected in pregnancy or shortly after delivery or at your child’s first MRI visit
    • \n\n
  • A blood sample taken from a vein in your arm of about 1 ½ tablespoons collected in pregnancy or shortly after delivery or at your child’s first MRI visit
    • \n\n
  • A sample of toenail or fingernail clippings (about the width of a quarter from all 10 nails) collected shortly after delivery or at your child’s MRI visit
    • \n\n
  • A saliva sample collected by spitting/drooling into a tube or having a cheek swab taken at 4 different study visits
    • \n
\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page4", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question35", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

You will be asked to allow us to collect some biological samples from your child that include the following:

\n\n
    \n
  • A urine sample of approximately 2-3 tablespoons to be collected at 4 different study visits
    • \n\n
  • A saliva sample collected by collecting saliva in a tube or swabbing the inside of the cheek at 4 different study visits
    • \n\n
  • A stool sample collected from your child’s diaper at 4 different study visits
    • \n
\n\n

The biological samples will be sent to storage facility (repository) and one or more laboratories. All samples from participants at all HBCD study sites will go to the same HBCD study repository.

\n\n

The study laboratory will analyze your and your child’s samples to evaluate proteins, tobacco, alcohol and other drugs you may have used (including illegal drugs), toxins, environmental exposures, normal bacteria in the gut, and nutrition (the “planned study analyses”). Your samples will NOT have your name or contact information on them when they go to the study repository or laboratory. They will only have a code number. In order to protect against possible legal risks, the results of these tests will not be returned to the research team at your site, so they will not know the individual results for you or your child.

\n\n

The study repository will store your samples so that other evaluations can be done in the future. For instance, in the future we plan to study your DNA (your genes or your whole genome) and some chemicals that turn your genes on and off (epigenetics). We will not do that research now, but we or somebody else will do it in the future.

\n\n

The repository can save your samples for many years so that researchers (including researchers who are not part of the HBCD study) could use them for other future research. We do not know what that other research would be.

" } ] }, { "name": "page5", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question11", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nPlease initial to indicate whether or not you agree to the following options:

\n\n

I agree to the planned study analyses of the biological samples that I and my child will provide to the HBCD study

" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "question4", "width": "100px", "minWidth": "100px", "maxWidth": "100px", "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "2-EsjuoU7fqq_iVeg", "text": "Yes" }, { "value": "78qQLyt2mHDFFFKd8", "text": "No" } ], "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:jcwkTWqbAAoXi82gB" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "question10", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Please Initial Here", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 100, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question12", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

I agree to future studies of my and my child’s genetic material from the biological samples that I and my child will provide to the HBCD study

" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "question13", "width": "100px", "minWidth": "100px", "maxWidth": "100px", "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "x1CDHKWqnm0CdATNa", "text": "Yes" }, { "value": "AablWnsKAj5rsAFCH", "text": "No" } ], "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:69m9mCcHNnma5ks5Y" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "question14", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Please Initial Here", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 100, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question15", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

I agree to future uses, not yet decided, for the biological samples that I and my child will provide to the HBCD study

" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "question16", "width": "100px", "minWidth": "100px", "maxWidth": "100px", "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "m4Wj7mpQGHFq7747a", "text": "Yes" }, { "value": "He0cV48hnalcCtNHO", "text": "No" } ], "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:G5ZtfZzkKSeQaBA3u" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "question17", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Please Initial Here", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 100, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question18", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

You and your child can still take part in the study if you do not agree to the options above. You can change your mind at any time about these options or about the study as a whole.

" } ] }, { "name": "page6", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question19", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

In the future, we will ask you for additional consent for the following study assessments and activities:

\n\n
    \n
  • We will ask your consent to video record some interaction and play with your child in your home.
    • \n\n
  • We will ask you to consent to release of your medical records related to your pregnancy and delivery.
    • \n\n
  • We will ask you each year to consent to release of medical records for your child.
    • \n
\n\n\n

If you agree, when your child is about 2 years old, we will ask the San Diego County Child Welfare Services about any services you and your child may have received from them in the past and the reasons for those services.

\n\n\n\n

\nPlease initial to indicate whether or not you agree to the following options:

\n\n

I agree to allow the study to contact San Diego County Child Welfare Services when my child is 2 years old to ask about any services I and my child may have received from them in the past and reasons for those services.

" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "question6", "width": "100px", "minWidth": "100px", "maxWidth": "100px", "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "EK5KALwHPXbbKAPbx", "text": "Yes" }, { "value": "gLyXq6h8LhXmUHy0n", "text": "No" } ], "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:BJhErWS9zqvwS2PFd" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "question7", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Please Initial Here", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 100, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question21", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

You and your child can still take part in the study if you do not agree to the options above. You can change your mind at any time about these options or about the study as a whole.

\n\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page7", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question22", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nHow much time will each study visit take and how long will the study last?

\n\n

Over the first approximately 4 years of the study, all study visits combined will require approximately 33-37 hours. The table below shows how many hours or minutes in total per visit during pregnancy for you and after delivery for the age range of your child. Many visit activities can be split into more than one session, some visit activities can be completed from your home, and some questionnaires can be completed in advance of a visit.

\n\n\n\n \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
Visit 1 prenatalVisit 2 1-2moVisit 3 3-9 moVisit 4 9-18 mo remoteVisit 5 9-15 moVisit 6 18-30 moVisit 6.5 18-48 mo remoteVisit 7 15-48 moVisit 36-60 mo remoteTotal
Approximate Time to Complete2.75 hours4.5 hours6.75 hours2 hours6.5 hours2.10 hours1.30 hours8.70 hours0.36 hours (20 minutes) 35 hours
\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page16", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question20", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nWhat risks are associated with this study?

\n\n

Participation in this study may involve some added risks or discomforts. In addition to the risks described at the beginning of this form,

\n\n
    \n
  • It is possible you or your child may become tired, bored, or frustrated during the study sessions. You and your child can take a break and/or stop at any time.
    • \n\n
  • It is possible that being asked about your feelings, mood, or about experiences with drugs, alcohol or other substances, or questions about your child may make you feel uncomfortable. In some cases you may skip questions that make you feel uncomfortable.
    • \n\n
  • You may feel brief pain, get a bruise or feel dizzy or faint during the blood drawn for thestudy during or shortly after pregnancy, but no more than the risks associated with blooddraws in routine clinical care.
    • \n\n
  • Risks with MRI:
    • \n\n
    • The MRI scanner makes loud noises when being used. Your child will be given earmuffs to help reduce the noise.
    \n\n
    • There are no known biological or reproductive risks from MRI scans. The procedure does not use radiation, like X-rays. However, because the MRI has a strong magnetic field, it is not safe to be in or around the scanner if your child has metal on his/her body (such as metal earrings). We will make sure it is safe for your child by asking you about any metal items before scheduling the scan and just prior to entering the scanner.
    \n\n
    • While in the scanner, your child may awaken or not be able to complete the scan. The study team will work with you and your child allowing as much time as needed to accommodate the child’s sleep and activity.
    \n\n
    • Although the MRI is not a diagnostic test, all scans will be reviewed by a radiologist. It is possible that we may detect an unexpected finding in the brain. This may be distressing to you. The unexpected findings will be discussed with you.
    \n
\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page8", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question29", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "
    \n
  • Because this is a research study, there may be some unknown risks that are currently unforeseeable. If there are significant new findings during the course of this research that may influence your willingness to continue to participate for yourself or your child, we will inform you of these findings.
    • \n\n
  • There is a risk of possible loss of confidentiality. There may be psychological or social risks associated with loss of privacy. While we believe the risks to you, your child, and your family are very low, we are not able to tell you exactly what all of the risks are.
    • \n\n
    • Your and your child’s privacy is very important to us, and we will use many safety measures to protect your and your child’s privacy. However, even with all the safety measures that will be used, we cannot guarantee that your or your child’s identity will never become known.
    \n\n
    • The databases we use to share data from this project have many controls in place to limit who can access the data. The database will not contain information that is normally used to identify you or your child, such as name, address, telephone number or social security number. However, people may develop ways to link de- identified information in these databases back to you or your child. For example, someone could compare information in our database to other databases and be able to identify you, your child or family members.
    \n\n
  • We may need to report information about known or reasonably suspected incidents of abuse or neglect of a child or elder including physical, sexual, emotional, and financial abuse or neglect. If anyone on the research team has or is given such information, they will be required to report such information to the appropriate authorities.
    • \n\n
  • If you or your child report intention to harm yourself or others to the research team, this will require a referral or report to the appropriate authorities.
    • \n
\n" } ] }, { "name": "page17", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question26", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nWhat are the alternatives to participating in this study?

\n\n

The alternative to participation in this study is not to participate.

\n\n\n

\nWhat happens if you change your mind about participating?

\n\n

Participation in this research is entirely voluntary. You may refuse to participate or withdraw at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you or your child are entitled. If you decide that you and your child no longer wish to continue in this study, you may notify Dr. Bandoli in writing to UC San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive (MC0828) La Jolla, CA 92093; by writing an email to hbcd@ucsd.edu; or calling Dr. Bandoli at (858) 246-1733.

\n\n

You will be told if any important new information is found during the course of this study that may affect your wanting to continue or allow your child to continue.

\n\n

\nWhat benefits can be reasonably expected?

\n\n

You or your child will not benefit directly if you and your child decide to take part in this research study. The investigators, however, may learn more about how the human brain develops over the first 10 years of life, and how various environmental factors may influence a child’s growth and development in those early years. While not a direct benefit of the study, we will provide information to you about referrals and community support that you may wish to access for you or your child.

\n" } ] }, { "name": "page9", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question39", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nCan you or your child be withdrawn from the study without your consent?

\n\n

You and your child may be withdrawn from the study if Dr. Bandoli or the HBCD investigators believe it is in your or your child’s best medical interest or if you do not follow the instructions from the study personnel.

\n\n\n\n

\nWill you be compensated for participating in this study?

\n\n

You will be compensated for your and your child’s time participating in the study approximately according to the amount of time required to complete the visit measures and to provide the biological samples. The following compensation schedule by each of the visits is as follows:

\n\n
    \n
  • Visit 1: $170
    • \n
  • Visit 2: $240
    • \n
  • Visit 3: $330
    • \n
  • Visit 4: $80
    • \n
  • Visit 5: $305
    • \n
  • Visit 6: $85
    • \n
  • Visit 6.5: $55
    • \n
  • Visit 7: $395
    • \n
  • Visit 8: $20
    • \n
\n\n

Total All Visits $1,680

\n\n

The payment will be given as cash, a gift card, or a reloadable credit card that can be used at stores, online or for cash at local banks. Study payments may be pro-rated if only part of a visit is completed.

\n\n

We will also reimburse you for transportation if needed for study visits, and will provide you with access to food, on-site childcare, and other small gifts such as diapers or a book or toy.

\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page10", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question42", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nAre there any costs associated with participating in this study?

\n\n

There will be no cost to you for participating in this study.

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question43", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nWhat if you or your child are injured as a direct result of being in this study?

\n\n

If you or your child are injured as a direct result of participation in this research, the University of California will provide any medical care you need to treat those injuries. The University will not provide any other form of compensation to you if you or your child are injured. You may call the Human Research Protections Program Office at 858-246-HRPP (858-246-4777) for more information about this, to inquire about your rights and your child’s rights as research subjects or to report research-related problems.

\n\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question44", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nWhat about your and your child’s confidentiality?

\n\n

Research records will be kept confidential to the extent allowed by law. This means what you tell us is not shared outside of the HBCD investigators and study team. Your records and your child’s records with your and your child’s name and contact information will be stored separately from data collected from you in a secure password protected computer file with access restricted to limited study personnel. Research records may be reviewed by the UCSD Institutional Review Board and the people who support this study at the National Institutes of Health.

\n\n

All results of your and your child’s information (for example, your responses to interviews and questionnaires) will be identified only by a unique participant code that contains no information about your or your child’s identity. Only the research team will have the information that matches the code to your identifying information, such as your or your child’s name, address and phone number. Drs. Bandoli and Gahagan and their staff will keep the information that matches the code to this identifying information in a password database for approximately 15 years or as long as the study has funding. Only very few authorized people, who have agreed to protect your and your child’s identity, will have access to this information that matches your and your child’s personal information to your unique code.

\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page11", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question46", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

In this coded form, the data will be entered into a database. This database will be accessible to the HBCD study researchers, and the data will also be placed in data repositories that are maintained or sponsored by the National Institutes of Health. The data will be made available broadly for research and development of new methods. This information may ultimately have significant therapeutic or commercial value. By agreeing for yourself and your child to participate in this study, you agree to such uses. Researchers who request access to your and your child’s data will have to agree not to try to identify individuals who have participated in the study. However, there is a small possibility that in the future an unauthorized attempt to identify you or your child as participants in the study could succeed.

\n\n

This research is covered by a Certificate of Confidentiality from the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Researchers with this Certificate may not disclose or use information, documents, or biological samples that may identify you or your child in any federal, state, or local civil, criminal, administrative, legislative, or other action, suit, or proceeding. Researchers may not disclose of use the information, documents, or biological samples as evidence unless you have consented for this use. Information, documents, or biological samples protected by this Certificate cannot be disclosed to anyone else who is not connected with the research unless there is a federal, state, or local law that requires disclosure (such as to report child abuse, elder abuse, intent to hurt self or others, or communicable diseases), you have consented to the disclosure, including for your or your child’s medical treatment; or it is used for other scientific research, as allowed by federal regulations protecting research subjects.\n

\n" } ] }, { "name": "page12", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question48", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

The Certificate cannot be used to refuse a request for information from personnel of federal or state government agency sponsoring the project that is needed for auditing or program evaluation by the National Institutes of Health which is funding the project. You should also understand that a Certificate of Confidentiality does not prevent you from voluntarily releasing information about yourself and your child or your and your child’s involvement in this research. If you want your or your child’s research information released to an insurer, medical care provider, or any other person not connected with the research, you must provide consent to allow the research to release it.

\n\n

If you agreed to genetic uses of your or your child’s biological samples, Federal and State laws generally make it illegal for health insurance companies, group health plans, and most employers to discriminate against you or your child based on your or your child’s genetic information. This law generally will protect you and your child in the following ways: a) Health insurance companies and group health plans may not request your or your child’s genetic information that we get from this research. b) Health insurance companies and group health plans may not use your or your child’s genetic information when making decisions regarding your or your child’s eligibility or premiums. c) Employers with 5 or more employees may not use your or your child’s genetic information that we get from this research when making a decision to hire, promote, or fire you or your child or when setting the terms of your employment.

\n" } ] }, { "name": "page13", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question50", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

Be aware that these laws do not protect you or your child against genetic discrimination by companies that sell life insurance, disability insurance, or long-term care insurance.

\n\n

Personal identifiers will be removed from the information collected as part of the research. After such removal, the information could be used for future research studies or distributed to another investigator for future research studies without your additional informed consent. If you consented to any of the uses of your or your child’s biological samples, this information could also be used for future research studies or distributed to other investigators for future research studies without your additional informed consent.

\n\n

Biological samples (such as blood, saliva, urine, nails or stool) collected from you and your child for this study and/or information obtained from your or your child’s biological samples may be used in this research or other research, and shared with other organizations. There is no intent to share these samples for purposes of any commercial value or profit that would be derived from their use or information obtained from them.

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question53", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

Will you receive any results about yourself or your child from participating in this study?

\n\n
    \n
  • While the study will not provide medical care, if the answers you give us in some of the questionnaires suggest that you are having serious problems with your mental health, we will let you know, and assist you in finding help.
    • \n\n
  • You will receive a summary of the results of the Bayley Scales of Infant Development testing for your child. This test is being used only for research purposes. But the test results may help you learn about strengths and weaknesses in your child’s development.
    • \n\n
  • One of the questionnaires you will be asked to complete asks about possible signs of autism in your child. If the results indicate that you should have your child evaluated further, we will let you know.
    • \n\n
  • If there is something the study doctors notice when looking at your child’s MRI scan that might need further evaluation, we will let you know and assist you in deciding what you can do next.
    • \n
\n\n" } ] }, { "name": "page14", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question54", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

Who can you call if you have questions?

\n\n

This study has been explained to you and your questions have been answered. If you have other questions or research-related problems, you may reach Dr. Bandoli at 858-246-1733.

\n\n

You may call the Human Research Protections Program Office at 858-246-HRPP (858-246- 4777) to inquire about your or your child’s rights as a research subject or to report research- related problems.

\n\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question1", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

\nYour Signature and Consent

\n\n

You have received a copy of this consent document and a copy of the “Experimental Subject's Bill of Rights” to keep.

\n" }, { "type": "text", "name": "firstName", "width": "275px", "minWidth": "275px", "maxWidth": "275px", "title": "First Name of Participant", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "readOnly": true, "surveyVariable": "ParticipantVariable:firstName" }, { "type": "text", "name": "lastName", "width": "275px", "minWidth": "275px", "maxWidth": "275px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Last Name of Participant", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "readOnly": true, "surveyVariable": "ParticipantVariable:lastName" }, { "type": "expression", "name": "Name of Child", "width": "550px", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "hideNumber": true, "expression": "\"Baby \" + {lastName}" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "parSignature", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "title": "Signature of Participant/Parent", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 150, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "text", "name": "question5", "minWidth": "200px", "maxWidth": "200px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Date", "hideNumber": true, "defaultValueExpression": "today()", "readOnly": true, "inputType": "date", "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:GbGJkk8BjDWPSszTf" }, { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "question9", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "title": "Signature of the person conducting the informed consent discussion", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "height": 150, "penColor": "#000000" }, { "type": "text", "name": "question8", "minWidth": "200px", "maxWidth": "200px", "startWithNewLine": false, "title": "Date", "hideNumber": true, "defaultValueExpression": "today()", "readOnly": true, "inputType": "date" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "Eligibility", "visible": false, "title": "Eligibility", "choices": [ { "value": "WGSS6PYWKGW4f3tSM", "text": "Potential Participant - Need to Contact and Screen" }, { "value": "RRWtotQ5KhoKnEAYd", "text": "Not Interested" }, { "value": "rBpE3FcP4zuWgczd6", "text": "Ineligible" }, { "value": "8xJgtts7GXDpMFyXP", "text": "Lost to follow-up (no response)" }, { "value": "M5X4D8uhgBANSioZ7", "text": "Active" }, { "value": "iKtPL687Dbgiz2str", "text": "Completed Study" }, { "value": "P45zgS6CK9gzxLEmi", "text": "Withdrawn" }, { "value": "y8w78C2HTKF48jKwC", "text": "Lost to follow-up" }, { "value": "vLA3RqnfeScwPbg3j", "text": "RA Unavailable/Missed - Reapproach" }, { "value": "P5RXhhxz6vLm8RF44", "text": "Eligible - Need to Contact and Consent" }, { "value": "jg7P4qcB99EPygYJa", "text": "No Show - Reapproach" }, { "value": "jMSbLNgZQXdouEGco", "text": "Active (On Hold)" } ], "surveyVariable": "StatusVariable:statusId" } ] }, { "name": "page15", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question24", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

We may wish to inform you about other studies. Please check the box below if you DO NOT wish to be contacted.

\n" }, { "type": "radiogroup", "name": "allowedToContact", "visible": false, "width": "550px", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "choices": [ { "value": "CTOL5U8hGEvmY4yDT", "text": "Yes, I can be contacted about other studies" }, { "value": "UEZNqDrPaL9nJTA6W", "text": "NO, I do not wish to be contacted about other studies." } ], "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:PLg64TfujQ7CECHxr" } ] }, { "name": "page99", "elements": [ { "type": "html", "name": "question27", "width": "600px", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

Human Research Protections Program University of California, San Diego

\n\n

(858) 246-4777 9500 Gilman Drive, Mail Code 0052

\n\n

(858) 246-3329 (FAX) La Jolla, CA 92093-0052

\n\n\n\n

\nEXPERIMENTAL SUBJECT’S BILL OF RIGHTS

\n\n

The faculty and staff of the University of California, San Diego wish you to know:

\n\n

Any person who is requested to consent to participate as a subject in a research study involving a medical experiment, or who is requested to consent on behalf of another, has the right to:

\n\n
    \n
  1. Be informed of the nature and purpose of the experiment.
    2. \n\n
  2. Be given an explanation of the procedures to be followed in the medical experiment, and any drug or device to be used.
    3. \n\n
  3. Be given a description of any attendant discomforts and risks reasonably to be expected from the experiment.
    4. \n\n
  4. Be given an explanation of any benefits to the subject reasonably to be expected from the experiment, if applicable.
    5. \n\n
  5. Be given a disclosure of any appropriate alternative procedures, drugs, or devices that might be advantageous to the subject, and their relative risks and benefits.
    6. \n\n
  6. Be informed of the avenues of medical treatment, if any, available to the subject after the experiment if complications should arise.
    7. \n\n
  7. Be given an opportunity to ask any questions concerning the experiment or the procedures involved.
    8. \n\n
  8. Be instructed that consent to participate in the medical experiment may be withdrawn at any time, and the subject may discontinue participation in the medical experiment without prejudice.
    9. \n\n
  9. Be given a copy of a signed and dated written consent form when one is required.
    10. \n\n
  10. Be given the opportunity to decide to consent or not to consent to a medical experiment without the intervention of any element of force, fraud, deceit, duress, coercion, or undue influence on the subject’s decision.
    11. \n
\n\n

If you have questions regarding a research study, the researcher or his/her assistant will be glad to answer them. You may seek information from the Human Research Protections Program - established for the protection of volunteers in research projects - by calling (858) 246-4777 from 7:30 AM to 4:00 PM, Monday through Friday, or by writing to the above address.

\n\n\n" } ] } ], "triggers": [ { "type": "setvalue", "expression": "{parSignature} notempty", "setToName": "Eligibility", "setValue": "M5X4D8uhgBANSioZ7" }, { "type": "setvalue", "setToName": "allowedToContact", "setValue": [ "ayod1yPILAqxCECZJ" ] }, { "type": "setvalue", "setToName": "allowedToContact", "setValue": [ "DJpcouNqXOeLsq3c2" ] }, { "type": "setvalue", "setToName": "allowedToContact", "setValue": "UEZNqDrPaL9nJTA6W" }, { "type": "setvalue", "setToName": "allowedToContact", "setValue": "CTOL5U8hGEvmY4yDT" } ], "clearInvisibleValues": "none" }

surveys.surveyJSON:
{
 "pages": [
  {
   "name": "page1",
   "elements": [
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "firstName",
     "title": "First Name",
     "isRequired": true,
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "ParticipantVariable:firstName"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "lastName",
     "startWithNewLine": false,
     "title": "Last Name",
     "isRequired": true,
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "ParticipantVariable:lastName"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "current_address",
     "title": "Current Address Line 1",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:RtSXYshjXxWuJgHCT"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "current_address2",
     "title": "Current Address Line 2",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:W62nbYyvDaPbovMiT"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "current_city",
     "title": "Current City",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:wGyaFr6iutRTJw5cK"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "current_state",
     "startWithNewLine": false,
     "title": "Current State",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:zuYWx9SgGxXbicyje"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "current_zip",
     "startWithNewLine": false,
     "title": "Current Zipcode",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:ZGAv5iEequYQayu24"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "cur_add_start_date",
     "visible": false,
     "title": "Current Start Date",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:MPAiM9dfjRQorMPmB"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "cur_old",
     "visible": false,
     "title": "Current Old Data",
     "readOnly": true,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:dAGBW8G7zx3gnqbfL"
    },
    {
     "type": "radiogroup",
     "name": "is_address_current",
     "title": "Is this the current address?",
     "choices": [
      {
       "value": "item1",
       "text": "Yes"
      },
      {
       "value": "item2",
       "text": "No"
      }
     ]
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "move_date",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "title": "When did you move?",
     "inputType": "date"
    },
    {
     "type": "expression",
     "name": "new_to_old",
     "visible": false,
     "title": "Store old address with the rest",
     "enableIf": "{is_address_current} <> 'item1'",
     "expression": "iif({is_address_current}='item1',{cur_old},{cur_old}+{current_address}+\",\"+{current_address2}+\",\"+{current_city}+\",\"+{current_state}+\",\"+{current_zip}+\",\"+{cur_add_start_date}+\",\"+{move_date}+\";\")",
     "useGrouping": false,
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:dAGBW8G7zx3gnqbfL"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "new_address_line1",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "title": "New Address Line 1",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:RtSXYshjXxWuJgHCT"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "new_address_line2",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "title": "New Address Line 2",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:W62nbYyvDaPbovMiT"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "new_city",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "title": "New City",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:wGyaFr6iutRTJw5cK"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "new_state",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "startWithNewLine": false,
     "title": "New State",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:zuYWx9SgGxXbicyje"
    },
    {
     "type": "text",
     "name": "new_zipcode",
     "visibleIf": "{is_address_current} = 'item2'",
     "startWithNewLine": false,
     "title": "New Zipcode",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:ZGAv5iEequYQayu24"
    },
    {
     "type": "expression",
     "name": "question6",
     "visible": false,
     "title": "Current Address Start Date",
     "expression": "{move_date}",
     "surveyVariable": "CustomVariable:MPAiM9dfjRQorMPmB"
    }
   ]
  }
 ],
 "clearInvisibleValues": "none"
}
